title: Background
text: three assumptions process data become missing [1]. Missing completely random (MCAR) Missing random (MAR) Missing random (MNAR)

title: Background
text: process data become missing random, missing data can formalised probabilistic perspective.

title: Background
text: following unifies formalisms [1], [2], [3]. D=(Dobs,Dmis)D = (D_{obs}, D_{mis}) DobsD_{obs} : observed values DD DmisD_{mis} : unobserved values DD MM : n√ópn \times p missingness indicator matrix, Mij=1M_{ij} = 1 DijD_{ij} observed 00 otherwise jj : distinct missing data pattern MM JJ : total jj SjS_j : set cases missing data pattern jj mjm_j : number cases SjS_j pjp_j : number observed variables SjS_j ùõç\boldsymbol{\mu} : population mean vector Œ£\Sigma : population covariance matrix ùõçÃÇ\hat{\boldsymbol{\mu}} : ML estimate ùõç\boldsymbol{\mu} Œ£ÃÇ\hat{\Sigma} : ML estimate Œ£\Sigma QjQ_j : p√ópjp \times p_j matrix indicating variables observed pattern jj ùõçÃÇobs,j\hat{\boldsymbol{\mu}}_{obs,j} : subset ùõçÃÇ\hat{\boldsymbol{\mu}} given ùõçÃÇobs,j‚â°ùõçÃÇQj\hat{\boldsymbol{\mu}}_{obs,j} \equiv \hat{\boldsymbol{\mu}}Q_j D‚Äæobs,j\bar{D}_{obs, j} : vector sample means observed variables pattern jj. Œ£ÃÇobs,j\hat{\Sigma}_{obs,j} : subset Œ£ÃÇ\hat{\Sigma} given Œ£ÃÇobs,j‚â°Qj‚ä§Œ£ÃÇQj\hat{\Sigma}_{obs,j} \equiv Q_j^{\top}\hat{\Sigma} Q_j Œ£ÃÉobs,j\tilde{\Sigma}_{obs, j} : accounts degrees freedom Œ£ÃÇobs,j\hat{\Sigma}_{obs,j} given Œ£ÃÉobs,j=nn‚àí1Œ£ÃÇobs,j\tilde{\Sigma}_{obs, j} = \frac{n}{n-1}\hat{\Sigma}_{obs,j} d2d^2 : statistic used test MCAR d2=‚àëj=1Jmj(D‚Äæobs,j‚àíùõçÃÇobs,j)Œ£ÃÉobs,j‚àí1(D‚Äæobs,j‚àíùõçÃÇobs,j)‚ä§d^2 = \sum_{j=1}^J m_j (\bar{D}_{obs, j} - \hat{\boldsymbol{\mu}}_{obs, j}) \tilde{\Sigma}_{obs, j}^{-1} (\bar{D}_{obs, j} - \hat{\boldsymbol{\mu}}_{obs, j})^{\top} = definitions MCAR, MAR, MNAR based probability distribution MM. P(M|D)=P(M)P(M|D) = P(M) P(M|D)=P(M|Dobs)P(M|D) = P(M|D_{obs}) P(M|D)=P(M|D)P(M|D) = P(M|D) summarised informally [1].

title: Background
text: [1] King G, Honaker J, Joseph , Scheve K. Analyzing Incomplete Political Science Data: Alternative Algorithm Multiple Imputation. American Political Science Review. 2001 March. [2] Little RJA. Test Missing Completely Random Multivariate Data Missing Values. Journal American Statistical Association. 1988;83(404):1198-202. [3] Rubin DB. Inference Missing Data. Biometrika. 1976;63(3):581-92. [4] Joseph G Ibrahim HZ, Tang N. Model Selection Criteria Missing-Data Problems Using EM Algorithm. Journal American Statistical Asso- ciation. 2008;103(484):1648-58. PMID: 19693282.

title: Introduction to missr
text: Missing data defined ‚Äúdata intended collect, one reason another unable ‚Äù [1].

title: Introduction to missr
text: Missing data represents loss information, reduces statistical power study [2].

what: Why can I not just impute the missing data?
title: Introduction to missr
text: Different methods handling missing data (e.g.¬†mean imputation) can introduce bias estimating statistics [3]. Therefore, produce unbiased estimates, one must choose correct method. order , one must understand categorise pattern missingness dataset. categorised missingness MCAR, MAR, MNAR (see vignette("background")) one can choose correct method handling missing data without introducing bias.

title: Introduction to missr
text: package provides three functions ‚Äî mcar(), mar(), mnar() ‚Äî help categorise missingness dataset. package also provides several toy datasets: animalhealth pollutionlevels healthcheck companydata testscores

title: Introduction to missr
text: lack information software practically categorising missing data.

title: Introduction to missr
text: [1] Carpenter JR, Kenward MG. Missing Data Randomised Controlled Trials: Practical Guide. Health Technology Assessment Methodology Programme; 2007. [2] Pham TM, Pandis N, White IR. Missing data: Issues, concepts, methods. Seminars Orthodontics. 2024;30(1):37-44. Statis- tics every orthodontist know. [3] van Buuren S. Flexible Imputation Missing Data, Second Edition. Chapman Hall/CRC; 2018.

what: Classify Missing Data as MCAR, MAR, or MNAR
title: Classify Missing Data as MCAR, MAR, or MNAR
text: goal missr help classify missing data MCAR, MAR, MNAR. providing: mcar() mar() mnar()

title: Classify Missing Data as MCAR, MAR, or MNAR
text: can install missr CRAN: can install development version github using remotes:

title: Classify Missing Data as MCAR, MAR, or MNAR
text: Null hypothesis data MCAR; p-value significant, evidence data MCAR. null hypothesis data MAR; p-value significant, evidence data MAR. new tests, simply process elimination.

title: Classify Missing Data as MCAR, MAR, or MNAR

title: Simulated animal health data (MCAR) ‚Äî animalhealth
text: toy dataset heart rate data various animals.

title: Simulated animal health data (MCAR) ‚Äî animalhealth
text: 200 x 2 data frame: animal animal interest hear_rate corresponding heart rate animal (bpm)

title: Simulated company data (MNAR) ‚Äî companydata
text: toy dataset typical company metrics across various firms.

title: Simulated company data (MNAR) ‚Äî companydata
text: 500 x 5 data frame: sales Sales last fiscal year (USD, million) marketing_spend Marketing spend last fiscal year (USD, million) product_rating Average rating across products employees Total employee count last fiscal year gross_profit Gross profit last fiscal year (USD, million)

title: Simulated health check data (MAR) ‚Äî healthcheck
text: toy dataset typical health check-metrics various individuals.

title: Simulated health check data (MAR) ‚Äî healthcheck
text: 200 x 5 data frame: bone_mass Bone mass individual (kg) body_fat Body fat percentage individual height Height individual (cm) age Age individual rbc Red blood cell count individual (million/mm^3)

title: Missing at random (MAR) test ‚Äî mar
text: mar() performs multiple logistic regressions test MAR. null hypothesis data MAR.

title: Missing at random (MAR) test ‚Äî mar
text: data data frame. debug logical value used unit testing.

title: Missing at random (MAR) test ‚Äî mar
text: tibble::tibble(): missing Column M missing data p_value Smallest p-value logistic regressions explanatory Variable corresponding p_value p_values p-values logistic regressions variables Variables corresponding p_values combined Paired p_values variables easier interpretation

title: Missing at random (MAR) test ‚Äî mar
text: following, column M missing data regressed D_obs. regression produces vector p-values (one variable D_obs). smallest p-value important. missing data need dependent one observed variable data MAR. reported smallest p-value significant, data MAR. See vignette("background") definitions M D_obs.

title: Missing at random (MAR) test ‚Äî mar
code: mar(healthcheck) #> Warning: essentially perfect fit: summary may be unreliable #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 6 #>   missing p_value explanatory p_values     variables    combined     #>   <chr>     <dbl> <chr>       <named list> <named list> <named list> #> 1 rbc     0.00188 age         <dbl [5]>    <chr [5]>    <dbl [5]>

what: Little's missing completely at random (MCAR) test ‚Äî mcar
title: Little's missing completely at random (MCAR) test ‚Äî mcar
text: mcar() performs Little's MCAR test test MCAR. null hypothesis data MCAR.

title: Little's missing completely at random (MCAR) test ‚Äî mcar
Little's missing completely at random (MCAR) test ‚Äî mcar
text: data data frame. debug logical value used unit testing.

title: Little's missing completely at random (MCAR) test ‚Äî mcar
text: tibble::tibble(): statistic d^2 statistic degrees_freedom Degrees freedom chi-squared distribution p_val P-value test missing_patterns Number missing patterns

title: Little's missing completely at random (MCAR) test ‚Äî mcar
text: function reproduces d^2 statistic equation (5) [1]. statistic used test MCAR. Comments reference variables vignette("background") (brackets) improve readability traceability.

title: Little's missing completely at random (MCAR) test ‚Äî mcar
text: Code adapted mcar_test() naniar package using base R instead tidyverse.

title: Little's missing completely at random (MCAR) test ‚Äî mcar
text: [1] Little RJA. Test Missing Completely Random Multivariate Data Missing Values. Journal American Statistical Association. 1988;83(404):1198-202.

title: Little's missing completely at random (MCAR) test ‚Äî mcar
code: mcar(pollutionlevels) #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 4 #>   statistic degrees_freedom p_val missing_patterns #>       <dbl>           <dbl> <dbl>            <int> #> 1      1.49               3 0.684                2

what: missr: Classify Missing Data as MCAR, MAR, or MNAR ‚Äî missr-package
title: missr: Classify Missing Data as MCAR, MAR, or MNAR ‚Äî missr-package
text: Classify missing data missing completely random (MCAR), missing random (MAR), missing random (MNAR). step required handling missing data (e.g. mean imputation) bias introduced. See Little (1988) doi:10.1080/01621459.1988.10478722  statistical rationale methods used.

title: missr: Classify Missing Data as MCAR, MAR, or MNAR ‚Äî missr-package
text: Maintainer: Noah William Trelawny Hellen noahhellen@gmail.com [copyright holder]

Missing not at random (MNAR) classification ‚Äî mnar
text: data data frame

text: list: mcar Results Little's MCAR test mar Results MAR test

title: Missing not at random (MNAR) classification ‚Äî mnar
text: exists formal test MNAR data. function therefore presents statistics tests mar() mcar(). results suggest data neither MAR MCAR, one can use process elimination deduce data MNAR.

title: Missing not at random (MNAR) classification ‚Äî mnar
code: mnar(companydata) #> Warning: essentially perfect fit: summary may be unreliable #> Warning: essentially perfect fit: summary may be unreliable #> $mcar #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 4 #>   statistic degrees_freedom  p_val missing_patterns #>       <dbl>           <dbl>  <dbl>            <int> #> 1      22.7              11 0.0197                4 #>  #> $mar #> # A tibble: 2 √ó 6 #>   missing        p_value explanatory    p_values     variables    combined     #>   <chr>            <dbl> <chr>          <named list> <named list> <named list> #> 1 product_rating  0.103  product_rating <dbl [5]>    <chr [5]>    <dbl [5]>    #> 2 employees       0.0128 gross_profit   <dbl [5]>    <chr [5]>    <dbl [5]>    #>

title: missr 1.0.0

title: missr 1.0.0
text: mar() function added statistically test MAR dataset. mcar() function added statistically test MCAR dataset. mnar() function added determine dataset MNAR.
